<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ee93b737aaa7bf65edc7281f429dd89fcf657a6f|patch 8.2.0117: crash when using gettabwinvar() with invalid arguments>
patch 8.2.0117: crash when using gettabwinvar() with invalid arguments

Problem:    Crash when using gettabwinvar() with invalid arguments. (Yilin
            Yang)
Solution:   Use "curtab" if "tp" is NULL. (closes #5475)

attachments.title: patch 8.2.0117: crash when using gettabwinvar() with invalid arguments · vim/vim@ee93b73
attachments.text: Problem: Crash when using gettabwinvar() with invalid arguments. (Yilin Yang) Solution: Use "curtab" if "tp" is NULL. (closes #5475)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ca7c078b799bfc96b54e9e41f5be3e0bfefadce5|patch 8.2.0118: crash when cycling to buffers involving popup window>
patch 8.2.0118: crash when cycling to buffers involving popup window

Problem:    Crash when cycling to buffers involving popup window .
Solution:   Do not decrement buffer reference count.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0118: crash when cycling to buffers involving popup window · vim/vim@ca7c078
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0118: crash when cycling to buffers involving popup window · vim/vim@ca7c078
attachments.text: Problem: Crash when cycling to buffers involving popup window . Solution: Do not decrement buffer reference count.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/1470dc35c4b14bda1995b7566c9a41a33eb06517|patch 8.2.0119: message test fails on some platforms>
patch 8.2.0119: message test fails on some platforms

Problem:    Message test fails on some platforms. (Elimar Riesebieter)
Solution:   Add type cast to vim_snprintf() argument. (Dominique Pelle)
